title: Facilitating Impact: Making Entrepreneurship and Diversity Everyone's Business
abstractText:
How can diversity and enterprise be made to be "everyone's business"? This project addresses this question by bringing together a variety of organisations to pilot innovative approaches to support diverse entrepreneurs (ie, ethnic minorities, women, and young people).

This unique collaboration will work in action learning sets to pioneer new ways of promoting development and growth of diverse SMEs through imaginative and productive relationships with large firms and private and public business service and finance providers.

The participants include senior staff from:

  • Barclays, Business in the Community
  • The Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (ACCA)
  • A. F. Blakemore & Son Ltd (a large firm that has mentored a network of African-Caribbean firms called the 12/8 Group to mutual benefit)
  • The Chartered Institute of Purchasing and Supply (CIPS)
  • The Consortium (a firm that is developing web-based mechanisms for linking SMEs with large purchasers)
  • The Equality and Human Rights Commission.

This initiative will produce genuinely 'actionable knowledge' on new ways of engaging with diverse entrepreneurs. The lessons learnt will be captured and recommendations made on the wider applicability of the approach. Further, with the active involvement of key partners there are clearly identifiable mechanisms to ensure that the knowledge, networks and impacts accruing from the project are sustained and built upon.
